poem:
**Moss and Breath**

Kristin points to the moss,
a soft jade stipple on timeless rock.
Her breath, a testament:
pure air,
unseen guardian 
of this green cradle.
I inhale, too,
buckles whispering secrets—
the unspoken pact of nature,
tales told without words,
a reassurance in every breath,
an affirmation in emerald silence.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
